implementation.name: POST /tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task. Receives a TaskCreate object and delegates to add_task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /tasks with task data:
    Validate the input as TaskCreate
    Call add_task(task) in database.py
    Return the created Task

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for adding a new task to the persistent storage. Called by the POST /tasks endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Load all tasks from tasks.json
Create a new Task object with a unique id and provided fields
Append the new Task to the list
Save the updated list to tasks.json
Return the new Task

implementation.name: PUT /tasks/{task_id}
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task. Receives updated TaskCreate data and delegates to update_task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a PUT request is made to /tasks/{task_id} with updated task data:
    Validate the input as TaskCreate
    Call update_task(task_id, task) in database.py
    If no task found, raise 404 error
    Return the updated Task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for updating an existing task in persistent storage. Called by the PUT /tasks/{task_id} endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Load all tasks from tasks.json
For each task in the list:
    If task.id matches task_id:
        Create a new Task with updated fields
        Replace the old task with the updated one
        Save the updated list to tasks.json
        Return the updated Task
If no task found, return None

implementation.name: DELETE /tasks/{task_id}
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete a task. Delegates to delete_task.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a DELETE request is made to /tasks/{task_id}:
    Call delete_task(task_id) in database.py
    If no task found, raise 404 error
    Return success message

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the logic for deleting a task from persistent storage. Called by the DELETE /tasks/{task_id} endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Load all tasks from tasks.json
Remove the task with matching id from the list
If a task was removed:
    Save the updated list to tasks.json
    Return True
Else:
    Return False

implementation.name: Task, TaskCreate, TaskBase
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the data models for tasks, including required fields and validation. Used throughout the API for input/output validation.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define TaskBase with fields:
    title (str, required)
    description (Optional[str])
    priority (Priority, default Medium)
    category (Optional[Category])
    due_date (Optional[date])
    completed (bool, default False)
TaskCreate inherits TaskBase
Task inherits TaskBase and adds id (str)

missing_implementations: Mark tasks as Completed or Pending (no dedicated endpoint or function for toggling/completing/pending a task; only full update via PUT)
A new task must include description, priority, and due date as required fields (currently only title is required; others are optional in TaskBase/TaskCreate)

implementation.name: App
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Main UI component that loads, filters, sorts, and displays tasks. Handles filter by status, sort by due date/priority, and passes data to TaskItem and TaskForm.
implementation.pseudo_code:
On mount:
    Call loadTasks to fetch all tasks
State:
    tasks: list of all tasks
    filterStatus: selected status filter (all/completed/pending)
    sortOption: selected sort (dueDate/priority)
    isFormOpen: controls TaskForm visibility
    editingTask: task being edited
    isLoading: loading state

loadTasks():
    Fetch tasks from API
    Set tasks state

handleCreateTask(taskData):
    Create task via API
    Reload tasks
    Close form

handleUpdateTask(taskData):
    Update task via API
    Reload tasks
    Close form

handleDeleteTask(id):
    Delete task via API
    Remove from tasks state

handleToggleComplete(task):
    Toggle completed status via API
    Reload tasks

filteredTasks = tasks
    Filter by filterStatus (all/completed/pending)
    Sort by sortOption (dueDate/priority)

Render:
    Filter and sort dropdowns
    List of filteredTasks rendered as TaskItem
    TaskForm for add/edit

implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Form UI for creating or editing a task. Allows user to set category, priority, due date, and other fields. Used by App for adding/editing tasks.
implementation.pseudo_code:
State:
    title, description, priority, category, dueDate

On submit:
    Build task object with title, description, priority, category, due_date
    Call onSubmit with task data

Render:
    Input for title
    Input for description
    Select for priority (Low/Medium/High)
    Select for category (Work/Personal/Study)
    Input for due date
    Save and Cancel buttons

implementation.name: TaskItem
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Displays a single task, showing its category, priority, due date, and status. Allows toggling completion, editing, and deleting.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Props:
    task, onToggleComplete, onDelete, onEdit

Render:
    Title (strikethrough if completed)
    Priority badge
    Category badge (if present)
    Description (if present)
    Due date (if present)
    Buttons: Done/Undo, Edit, Delete

On Done/Undo:
    Call onToggleComplete(task)
On Edit:
    Call onEdit(task)
On Delete:
    Confirm and call onDelete(task.id)

missing_implementations: Tasks can be categorized (e.g., Work, Personal, Study) - UI allows selection and display, but there is no explicit UI or logic for filtering tasks by category.
